State unemployment agencies are overwhelmed by the deluge of claims. People who needed checks yesterday may not get them for weeks. The Senate needs to find more ways to get relief directly into the hands of people who need it – not April 20, but now. https://www.cbsnews.com/news/unemployment-benefits-millions-wait-for-jobless-pay-as-state-agencies-seek-more-workers-from-stimulus/

Ain't No Sunshine... today.

I am so sad at Bill Withers’ passing.

In this time of death and pain, I hold onto him. He was a true great soul singer. Most of my campaign events we played Lovely Day.

He gave us lifetimes of light and that flame will never be extinguished.

10 million have already filed for unemployment.

3.5 million have already lost their health insurance.

Good-quality health care should not be tied to your job.

At a minimum, the government must ensure health care for all, without cost, for the duration of this crisis. https://twitter.com/benzipperer/status/1245729562857746432 QT @benzipperer 🚨3.5 million workers likely lost their employer provided health insurance in the past two weeks🚨

The COVID-19 pandemic lays bare the cruelty of tying health insurance coverage to employment https://www.epi.org/blog/3-5-million-workers-likely-lost-their-employer-provided-health-insurance-in-the-past-two-weeks/ http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUmr55sXgAI-PWp.jpg

The coronavirus has infected nearly a quarter million Americans—more than in any other country on Earth.

It is absurd to keep 87 million people uninsured or underinsured during this pandemic.

Let us learn from this crisis. Let us make health care a human right in America.

We’re up to about 90% of Americans being under shelter-in-place orders. It should be 100 percent. #FamiliesFirst #LSSC http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtdszpWsAczSMu.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1246076142274166784/vid/480x270/GRwzWVSTS2whGSdm.mp4?tag=13

Hey @blackwomenviews, I’m answering your question! And here’s the deal: this crisis is highlighting disparities in our health care system that existed long before COVID-19. We have to start by gathering demographic data on testing, treatment, and fatalities. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtHdJ8WoAECBuR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1246167174563221506/vid/320x320/zMgJ6Xau0kw-k-DW.mp4?tag=13

Our jails and prisons are overcrowded and lack basic hygiene options and health care.

It’s not only inhumane—it makes coronavirus outbreaks inevitable. And as staff cycle through, it will spread.

States must act to reduce jail and prison populations. 

https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/apr/01/rikers-island-jail-coronavirus-public-health-disaster

It is a national shame that grocery store workers, food service employees, custodians, bus drivers, and so many other essential workers are so underpaid. We should renew our commitment to getting these hard-working people the living wage that they deserve. #RaiseTheWage https://twitter.com/JohnHenryStyle/status/1245154172082798599 QT @JohnHenryStyle Suddenly, the whole nation is depending on the same people they say shouldn’t make $15 an hour.

The paid sick leave policies @Instacart, @DoorDash, @Grubhub, & @UberEats are touting here are the same ones I wrote to them about. They require medical documentation or only kick in with a confirmed diagnosis. And workers report being denied sick leave even with a doctor's note. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EUtLdMWWoAInsh7.jpg

Over 10 million Americans filed for unemployment benefits in March. That number could double or even triple in the weeks ahead. A $1200 check isn’t going to cut it for working families hanging on by a thread. https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/04/02/jobless-march-coronavirus/

States like MA are still scrambling every way they can to get equipment for their frontline health workers. The Senate must force Trump to fully use the DPA for ventilators, test kits, masks, & everything else our health workers have needed for weeks. https://www.washingtonpost.com/sports/2020/04/02/patriots-robert-kraft-uses-team-plane-help-get-n95-masks-massachusetts-ny-hospitals/

Just as other countries have, including the UK, Norway, and Denmark, we must make sure that every worker in America continues to receive their paycheck during this crisis, retroactive to the beginning of the crisis.

The $350b for small biz is slower, w/ more strings, & less liquid.

Let's all continue to live by his cherished lyrics during these times and lean on each other.

COVID deaths are disproportionately spiking in Black + Brown communities.
